quest.name: Turndown Service
journal: Geva has a task that demands your attention.

Geva has received a rare request from Ishgard for a sample of Fen–Yll's finest work. The guildmaster needs you to take it to a merchant named Elde. However, she also wishes you to turn Elde down in no uncertain terms should she wish to make a substantial order. The toll of large-scale trade with Ishgard would simply be too costly for the life in the Black Shroud. Make your way to the Jeweled Crozier, and speak with the merchant.

You meet with Elde, and deliver Geva's message. Nevertheless, the merchant sees a new opportunity in you, Geva's disciple. As her shop is newly opened, she asks that you serve as an advisor, and consult with her about leatherwork. Your first task, so to speak, is speaking with the shopkeeps along the Jeweled Crozier, for something is not right in the markets of Ishgard.

After speaking to a number of merchants, you are left with the impression that the Jeweled Crozier has goods for either the very rich, or the very poor─but nothing in between. Return to Elde, and report your findings.

Elde confirms your assessment of the Jeweled Crozier, and lays before you her mission. She means to provide high-quality products to everyone at reasonable prices, regardless of their station. She bids you to join her crusade if it speaks to you.

※The next leatherworker quest will be available from Elde upon reaching level 53.
objectives: Deliver the selection of guild samples to Elde at the Jeweled Crozier.
Speak with the merchants at the Jeweled Crozier.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Good. Something has happened recently that has not happened in a long time─an order has come from Ishgard.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: A merchant named Elde has requested a selection of Fen–Yll's finest goods. I've seen to it personally that she will get our best.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: I want you to deliver the guild samples to her at the Jeweled Crozier, but only because I can trust the important part of this task to you and you alone.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: If I know anything of merchants, this is a prelude to a substantial order. The guild will not take it. Our production puts the balance of the Twelveswood in enough peril as it is.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: There. I believe you can turn her down without offering offense─and if she is insistent, you have learned how to say no from me. In any case, I trust I won't be hearing more about the matter.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Have you forgotten where Elde is already? The Jeweled Crozier in Ishgard.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: Welcome, welcome to Elde's House of Excellence! Our signboard is newly hung, but I promise you'll find no finer leatherwork in all of Ishgard.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: Oh! The guild representative─I beg your pardon, misssir! I did not expect you so soon. If you will allow me to look at your samples...

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: Goodness, Fen–Yll's finery puts my best to shame! These will sell splendidly! Please, deliver your guildmaster my compliments, and an order for...for one thousand circles of leather!

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: You...you can't!? ...No, no, you have the right of it. <sigh> I should've known filling such a large purchase would mean a great loss of life in the Black Shroud.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: I'm very new to this, honestly. Could you help me? Oh, excuse me, that was rather forward. It's just...your hands. They're the hands of a true artisan, calloused but strong. Deft.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: I'm a poor leatherworker myself, and I could use an experienced advisor, someone who can give me a fresh perspective. And we are all in dire need of a fresh perspective.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: ...But I should let you draw your own conclusions, shouldn't I? Please, go and speak with the shopkeeps around here as a customer. I'm certain you'll see what I'm getting at.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: Lost as to where to begin? Well, what about Mathye? He's the fellow just behind my shop. Oh, but don't let him know I sent you!

dialogue.name: MATHYE
dialogue.text: Ah, my dear misssir, what house do you serve? Oh, I see─shopping for yourself, eh? Well, my wares are most reasonably priced! In fact, I take great pride in delivering the cheapest of goods to the lowborn! I will not be undersold!

dialogue.name: ELAISSE
dialogue.text: A warm welcome to you, misssir! Please, feel free to visit our many, many shops.

dialogue.name: ELAISSE
dialogue.text: From highborn lords to working commoners, we strive to accommodate everyone's needs. But one word about the cheaper merchandise: if it seems too good to be true, it most likely is.

dialogue.name: GERHARDT
dialogue.text: ...If you must go shopping, kindly do so in the Brume, sir!

dialogue.name: GERHARDT
dialogue.text: What? Must I repeat myself again and again!? I do not have anything to sell to the likes of you! Do you understand!? You do not have the gil to buy what I have to offer!

dialogue.name: GERHARDT
dialogue.text: Tch, I have wasted far too much time explaining myself. I have an appointment with the Count de Durendaire. Good day, misssir!

dialogue.name: KYAKU02075
dialogue.text: All I wanted was to give me daughter a nice dress for her nameday. I've even got the bloody gil! Why can't the poor get nothin' nice, even if we've got the coin to buy!?

dialogue.name: KYAKU02075
dialogue.text: Bloody merchants. They're why we can't have nice things...

dialogue.name: ORTEFAUCHEL
dialogue.text: Pardon me, madam─which of these is best? I need a present to charm my wife, and I can't choose between what all seem to be splendid bags.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: Thank you for saying so, sir. But if you aren't in a hurry, we're scheduled to get a shipment of far finer than these soon.

dialogue.name: ORTEFAUCHEL
dialogue.text: Finer, eh? Well, only the best for my bride. Could you hold your favorite for me, under the name Ortefauchel?

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: Ah, how did you find the shopkeeps? Something in their attitude struck you as amiss, yes?

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: Yes, the merchants are concerned only with the coin of nobles, and pay little heed to any need of the lowborn that is not low price.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: The artisans aren't much better. Those that fail to please the High Houses are overwhelmed with orders. They slap something shoddy together, and sell it to the commoners. As a result, it's difficult for many Ishgardians to find anything but the worst of goods.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: But why, I ask you? Is a commoner's coin lesser than a lord's? Shouldn't merchants offer high-quality products for everyone?

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: I believe we should. We all deserve well-made goods that are within our budgets. So I opened this shop for all Ishgard, from the Hoplon to the Brume.

dialogue.name: ELDE
dialogue.text: Not everyone shares my belief. But if you see the value in my ideas, I'd love to have your expert advice. I do hope we meet again, my friend.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next leatherworker quest will be available from Elde upon reaching level 53.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your skills as an artisan would be put to great use in crafting collectables. Speak with Morgayne at Saint Reinette's Forum in Ishgard to learn more of this lucrative business opportunity.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you seek even greater tests of your crafting prowess, you would do well to acquire master recipes.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with Guiding Star at Revenant's Toll to learn about them.
